items.source: Type 1: It is possible and also very likely that the condition will be fulfilled.
examples: Example: If I find her address, Iâ€™ll send her an invitation.

items.source: Type 2: It is possible but very unlikely, that the condition will be fulfilled.
items.translate: Form: if + Simple Past, Conditional I (= would + Infinitive)
examples: Example: If I found her address, I would send her an invitation.

items.source: Type 3: It is impossible that the condition will be fulfilled because it refers to the past.
items.translate: Form: if + Past Perfect, Conditional II (= would + have + Past Participle)
examples: Example: If I had found her address, I would have sent her an invitation.
